item.title: Drupal Debug Trick: debug_backtrace / debug_print_backtrace
item.description: PENDING … ORIGINAL POST â†“ I find this useful as a less memory intensive Drupal-friendly way to backtrace PHP as a one-off code snippet to temporarily drop into a troublesome location without installing modules or server-side tools: 1 2 3 4 5 6 $trace = debug_backtrace(); $backtrace_lite = array(); foreach( $trace as $call ) { $backtrace_lite[] = $call['function']." ".$call['file']." line ".$call['line']; } debug( $backtrace_lite, "TRACE", true ); It gets the backtrace into Drupal’s debugging system, but strips it down to the essentials to avoid failures when massive objects are involved.

item.title: How to apply patch in drupal ?
Install drush on drupal 8 site (using downgraded composer ver.1)
item.description: Intuition I was recently working on a client site, and I got to the issue where the site will show “Page unavailable” upon login.
